page.title: 09Appleby Castle
page.content: Appleby Castle dateing to the eleventh century is the headquarters of Ferguson Industrial Holdings.The grounds are a Conservation Centre for rare animals and birds.The castle is open to the public during the spring and summer.It costs 50p for children and Â£1 for adults Appleby Castle is at the top of Boroughgate.The main gates are very big and if you are at High Cross you can't miss them.Just through the gates on your left hand side there is a carpark ,picnic area and a Tarzan Trail.A bit further up there is a path that you can walk down and look at the different kinds of animals,like foxes, sheep,bulls,chipmunks and owls.The Castle specialises in keeping rare breeds of poultry.Under the keep there is a souvenir shop which used to be a dungeon. Lee Gasgarth
